page.title: 12FARM BUILDINGS IN FINZEAN.
page.content: The farm buildings are mostly granite built with slated roofs,forming three sides of a square and dating from the latter 19th century. The inner courtyards were roofed over with asbestos or corrugated iron during the past 30 years to house cattle in winter. Dutch barns and silage pits have also been added during this period. Most farms have smaller timber built sheds for implements and storage. Thelargest steading, at Finzean Home Farm has a granite Georgian front built in 1805 in the form of a square was recently reroofed for grain and forage storage, implements, workshops and tractor shed. {Redundant farm buildings have been {sold for conversion to dwelling {houses.
